{{pp-protected|expiry=2011-12-17T15:49:09Z|small=yes}}<!-- This page has been automatically assigned the correct protection templates by [[User:Lowercase sigmabot]]. If the protection templates are wrong, please fix them. Thanks. --> [[File:Wiki-fisting.png|thumb|An illustration of a woman engaged in the sexual activity known as fisting, in which a hand is inserted into the [[vagina]] or [[rectum]].]] {{wiktionary|fisting|handballing|brachioproctic insertion|brachiovaginal insertion|fist-fucking}} '''Fisting''', '''handballing''', '''fist-fucking''', '''brachiovaginal''', or '''brachioproctic insertion'''<ref>{{cite book|last=Herrman|first=Bert|title=Trust--the hand book : a guide to the sensual and spiritual art of handballing|year=1991|publisher=Alamo Square Press|location=San Francisco|isbn=978-0-9624751-5-3|url=http://books.google.com/?id=o1ZvK2UC4FQC&q=Trust;+the+hand+book,+a+guide+to+the+sensual+and+spiritual+art+of+handballing.&dq=Trust;+the+hand+book,+a+guide+to+the+sensual+and+spiritual+art+of+handballing.}}</ref> is a [[Human sexual activity|sexual activity]] that involves inserting a hand into the [[vagina]] or [[rectum]]. Once insertion is complete, the fingers either naturally clench into a fist or remain straight. In more vigorous forms of fisting, such as "punching / punchfisting ", a fully clenched fist may be inserted and withdrawn slowly. Fisting may be performed with or without a partner.
==Techniques== [[File:Silentduck.jpg|right|thumb|The beak-like "silent duck" used in the initial stages of fisting.]] [[File:Anal Fisting.jpg|right|thumb|100px|A man being anally fisted]] The "Silent Duck", also called "Duck-Billing", is the technique much often used in which the person engaging in hand insertion shapes the hand to resemble a duck's beak. Typically, fisting does not involve forcing the clenched fist into the vagina or rectum. Instead, all five fingers are kept straight and held as close together as possible (forming the [[beak]]-like "duck"), then slowly inserted into a well lubricated vagina or rectum.<ref>Herrman 1991, pp. 46-47</ref>
Fistees who are more experienced may take two fists (double-fisting) in the vagina or rectum. In the case of double-fisting, pleasure is derived more from the stretching of the [[anus]] or [[vagina]] than from the [[thrust]]ing (in-and-out) movement of hands.<ref>Herrman 1991, p. 58</ref>
For anal fisting a lubricant is typically used.
==Risks== Fisting can cause [[laceration]] or [[organ perforation|perforation]] of the [[vagina]], [[perineum]], [[rectum]], and/or [[Colon (anatomy)|colon]], resulting in serious injury<ref>Cohen, C.E., Giles, A., Nelson, M. Sexual trauma associated with fisting and recreational drugs. ''Sex Transm Infect'' 2004; '''80''':469–70.</ref> and even death. <ref>Preuss, J. Death after anal "fisting". ''Arch Kriminol'' 2008; '''221''':28–35.</ref> <ref>Torre, C. Delayed death from fisting. ''Am J Forens Med Pathol'' 1987; '''8''':91.</ref> <ref>Fain, D.B.; McCormick, G.M. Vaginal "fisting" as a cause of death ''Am J Forens Med Pathol'' 1989; '''10''':73–5.</ref> <ref>Reay, D., Eisele, J. Sexual abuse and death of an elderly lady by "fisting". ''Am J Forens Med Pathol'' 1983; '''4''':347–9.</ref>  In general, sexual activities that cause air to enter the vagina can lead to a fatal [[air embolism]], and the risk is probably even higher during pregnancy.<ref>Kaiser, R.T.Air embolism death of a pregnant woman secondary to orogenital sex. ''Acad Emerg Med'' 1994; '''1''':555–8.</ref>
Anal fisting carries risks of colorectal perforation; participants are advised to use latex gloves and lubricant, and designate a [[safeword]], the utterance of which will call an immediate halt to the activity. The practice along with the insertion of hard objects into the anus has been significantly related to the traumatization of the rectal mucosa in increasing the likelihood of infection, including [[Hepatitis B virus|Hepatitis B]].<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=wq7fSNgUZKQC "AIDS and behavior: an integrated approach"], Judith Auerbach. National Academies Press, 1994. ISBN 0-309-05093-6, ISBN 978-0-309-05093-7. p. 49</ref>

Brachioproctic eroticism and transmission of retrovirus associated with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS). ''Genitourin Med.'' 1986 Dec;62(6):390-2. * {{cite book |last=Herrman |first=Bert |title=Trust, the Hand Book: A Guide to the Sensual and Spiritual Art of Handballing |year=1991 |publisher=Alamo Square Press |location=San Francisco |isbn=0-9624751-5-7 }} * {{cite book | last =Inciardi | first =James A. | coauthors = Surratt, Hilary L.; Telles, Paulo R. | title = Sex, Drugs, and HIV/AIDS in Brazil | publisher = Westview Press | date = November 1, 2000 | isbn = 0-8133-3424-1 }}</small> * Medical terminology and some information on risks were taken from [http://www.winternet.com/~redright/aimgth.htm#anchorTOP The Intelligent Man's Guide To Handball] {{dead link|date=April 2012}}, a guide to man-on-man fisting.{{Refend}}
